data.title: 7 FUN FACTS TO HELP YOU REMEMBER BRACEFACE
data.text:
1. SHARON BROUGHT THE MAIN CHARACTER ENERGY ALWAYS

“Sharon, the unstoppable force of positivity in the animated world of Braceface! With boundless energy and an infectious spirit, she brought life to every episode. From navigating the highs and lows of adolescence to facing the challenges of braces, Sharon’s vibrant personality made her the main character we all cheered for. Brace yourself for a dose of laughter, growth and friendship as Sharon lights up the screen with her unmistakable energy!”

2. SHARON DISCOVERED SHE CAN COMMUNICATE WITH ANIMALS

In a surprising twist of fate, Braceface’s protagonist, Sharon, stumbles upon a magical ability that’s more than just a conversation starter—she can talk to animals. From heart-to-heart talks with her pets to hilarious encounters with wildlife.

3. BRACEFACE IS ORIGINATED IN CANADA

“Braceface” is a Canadian animated series produced by Nelvana Limited, a renowned animation studio based in Canada. The show was well-received not only in Canada but also in various other countries.

4. IT WAS A 2000’S VIBE FOR SURE!

The show captured the essence of adolescence in an era marked by funky fashion, flip phones and the struggle of navigating the awkward yet endearing challenges of teenage life. Sharon’s magical braces added a whimsical touch to her journey, turning each episode into a delightful blend of humor, life lessons and the unmistakable charm of the early 2000s.

5. ALICIA SILVERSTONE IS THE VOICE BEHIND SHARON

The fabulous Alicia Silverstone, the voice behind our fearless and fashionable protagonist, Sharon! Cher Horowitz from ‘Clueless’ may have had a way with words, but in Braceface, Alicia brings Sharon to life with her infectious charm and wit.

6. BRACEFACE MADE US ALL WANT BRACES TOO

The show that turned awkward into awesome and had us all secretly wishing for metal mouth chic! Sharon Spitz made braces the ultimate accessory, proving that navigating adolescence with a mouth full of metal could be both relatable and stylish. Suddenly, we were all on a quest for that brace-faced glow-up, hoping for a dash of Sharon’s coolness to accompany our dental journey.

7. IT MADE JUNIOR HIGH SEEM LIKE A PLACE WE WANNA GO

Suddenly, lockers, lunchrooms and algebra felt like the ultimate adventure zones. ‘Braceface’ turned junior high into a land of potential friendships, crushes and epic mishaps, making us wish we could trade places with Sharon Spitz and dive headfirst into the thrilling chaos of teenage life. Who knew that the ups and downs of junior high could be so irresistibly entertaining?”
